School of Business and Economics

Announcements



  SBE Support Available: The SBE front office is ready to assist faculty, staff, and students remotely.
Hours: Monday-Friday, 8am-5pmEmail: Contact UsPhone: (707) 664-2377
 
  










Welcome to the School of Business and Economics at Sonoma State University!
At the School of Business and Economics (SBE), our mission is to inspire our community of students, faculty, staff, and alumni every day. We have clear values that guide our actions and a deliberate strategy for achieving our mission.

Our Mission:
SBE is committed to changing the world through growing leaders that are courageous, curious and kind and who change the world through data insights, entrepreneurship and purpose-driven business in the fields of Accounting, Economics, Analytics, Finance, Marketing, Management and Wine Business.

Our Values:
Our core values serve as guiding principles for how we lead. They represent our commitment to excellence and bringing our best selves to everything we do.

Our Strategy:
Our mission requires a bold strategy. By unlocking the potential of every student, we align business and society to be connected to long-term value, including the differentiated needs it addresses for all its stakeholders.
I look forward to hearing from you over the next year and seeing your success stories in action.
Sincerely and warm regards,
Dr. Michael Visser, Ph.D.

Professional Programs




Access


 
















 





 


The School has so many connections to the local community, which produces a multitude of mentorship opportunities. I feel very fortunate that I had the opportunities to explore my interests and find a company that I love.





Annie Azevedo '17, Business Accounting | Tax Associate, BPM



 
   





 


The Economics Department is phenomenal. The classes are very applied and you are learning real-world skills that you can go out in the business world and immediately implement.





Angie Martinez '12/'14, B.A. in Economics/Sonoma MBA | Data Analyst, Kiosk



 
   





 


The Sonoma MBA has a flexible schedule that allowed me to pursue my master's while working full-time. The program provided dynamic projects that emphasized efficient communication and an understanding of creating and sustaining a business.





Ranjot "Ricky" Sidhu '16, Sonoma Professional MBA | Accounting Manager, Green Toys

Entrepreneurship & Innovation




Go to the Entrepreneurship & Innovation








 










 


AACSB




Internationally-Accredited




AACSB accreditation is the hallmark of excellence in business education and has been earned by less than five percent of the world's business schools. 


   


$400,000




Wine Business Scholarships




The Wine Business Institute awards scholarships to undergraduate and MBA students each year. 


   


300




Annual Internships




The SBE Career Center connects students with internships at firms and organizations across the San Francisco North Bay area. 


   


100




Annual Mentorships




Approximately 100 students are paired with members of the business community each year to learn about possible career paths.


   


21%




First-Gen Students




Nearly a quarter of business and economics students are the first in their family to attend college.


   


#12




Best Colleges for Transfer Students




Sonoma State University is ranked No. 12 for exemplary service and awarding degrees to students who transfer from community colleges and other universities. - Money Magazine


   


#14




Top Public Schools in the West




Sonoma State University is ranked No. 14 for Top Public Regional Universities in the West. - U.S. News & World Report


 


Previous Next 











    Inclusive Excellence  


In the School of Business and Economics (SBE) at Sonoma State University (SSU), we recognize that our community's success rests on how the SBE values, engages, and includes the diversity of students, faculty, staff, and alumni. We aim to achieve equity in access, student success, and high-quality learning for each of our students. To do so, we know we cannot go it alone, and that is why we seek collaboration, partnership, and investment from our community. 
 
More on Inclusive Excellence
